alert.note: Alert for Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 19 at 12:23PM PST until January 23 at 12:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Very high tides expected. * WHERE...Beaches of San Diego County and Orange County. * WHEN...From late tonight through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...The morning high tides could result in minor tidal overflow, bringing some ponding of sea water to vulnerable areas, including parking lots at low-lying beach areas. Beaches most prone include Sunset, Seal, Newport, Oceanside, Cardiff, La Jolla Shores and Imperial. Extreme low tides around minus 2 feet may also impact boats in harbor and affect navigation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... Friday: High 6.73 ft at 7:15 AM. Low -1.84 ft at 2:39 PM. Saturday: High 6.96 ft at 8:03 AM. Low -1.99 ft at 3:21 PM. Sunday: High 6.93 ft at 8:50 AM. Low -1.89 ft at 4:02 PM. Monday: High 6.61 ft at 9:37 AM. Low -1.55 ft at 4:42 PM.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas
